sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now with me, Takumbo Sulako. Let's take a look at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron's plans to annoy France's unvaccinated create widespread anger as debate continues over a new health pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: After days of protests over fuel prices in Kazakhstan, the president sacks the cabinet, declaring an emergency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Kazakhstan, the president sacks the cabinet, declaring an emergency. And there's fury down under after the world's number one tennis star Novak Djokovic receives the medical exemption to play at the Australian Open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tensions are rising as quickly as the number of Covid cases in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Lawmakers continue to be divided over increasing pressure on people to get a jab by making a vaccination pass mandatory to use public spaces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And that's as more than 270,000 infections were recorded in the space of 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And now President Macron, using forthright language, has told a magazine that he's willing to annoy France's 5 million unvaccinated. In fact, he's vowing to piss them off. Opponents have said that's no way for a head of state to talk. Meanwhile, in the UK, despite recording 200,000 daily COVID cases, Prime Minister Boris Johnson says he's willing to ride out the current wave of infections without further curbs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thanks to the fantastic national effort to get Britain boosted, we now have a substantial level of protection. And so, together with the Plan B measures that we introduced before Christmas, we have a chance to ride out this Omicron wave without shutting down our country. In the U.S., Joe Biden is increasing stocks of new Pfizer therapeutic pills designed to combat the worst effects of COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The U.S. president is going for a multi-pronged attack. Omicron is very transmissible, transmissible variant, but much different than anything we've seen before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But you can protect yourself, and you should protect yourself, quite frankly. Get vaccinated, get boosted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There's plenty of booster shots. Wear a mask.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But while the arguments are being made, Beijing is holding on to its zero-Covid strategy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Three asymptomatic cases of Covid-19 were enough for the Chinese authorities to lock down a city of almost 1.2 million people, joining 13 million others in lockdown in Xi'an.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron's decision to speak out in what some would say are vulgar terms about how he intends to deal with France's unvaccinated population has sparked a renewed debate about the use of presidential language as well as the right way to convince people to get the jab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, let's hear more now from our international correspondent Anneliese Borges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Anneliese, tell us more about his controversial comments. What exactly did he mean? Well, Emmanuel Macron was talking about the constraints that are going to be imposed on the lives of those who have decided not to take a COVID jab come January 15th. That's the deadline the government is working with to create a vaccine pass, a pass that will replace the current health path that allows people to access public venues such as bar cafes and restaurants and even theaters simply by showing a negative pcr test or proof they've recovered from govind 19 or proof of a jab now emmanuel macron says that those days are over and that people will have to get vaccinated to continue to live a somewhat normal life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But his tone and the choice of words do criticism from opposition politicians, including the leader of the far right, Marine Le Pen, who said that his comments were unworthy of a president of his office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The expression used by Emmanuel Macron talks, emmerder les Fran√ßais, comes from the word merde, that many of you might be familiar with, and is considered to be very informal here in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Very informal, but a word that we often hear here in France, one has to say. And Alisa, this all comes as Parliament has been debating this new vaccine pass, as you mentioned. What's the latest on that? Tell us more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Well, members of the French Parliament decided to suspend that debate once again late last night, shortly after word of the choice of words by Emmanuel Macron created another row in the lower house of Congress, further delaying, of course, government plans to in-store this pass by January 15th. The session is supposed to resume later today, but today is the day that the bill was already supposed to be in the Senate for a vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's going to be very interesting to see how this all plays out in the next few days and weeks, Toks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The government is adamant here in France that the only weapon in this war is the vaccine and wants all the French to get a jab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: is the vaccine and wants all the French to get a jab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The argument continues to be that, but it's important to note that over 90% of the French have already received at least one dose of the vaccine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, government figures show that 85% of those patients currently being treated in ICUs for COVID-19 are unvaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kazakhstan's President Kazim Jomartokheyev has dismissed his government in response to rare

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: protests in the oil-rich Central Asian country. The violent scenes, linked to the rise in gas prices, have triggered a state of emergency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It includes a curfew, restrictions on movement and a ban on mass gatherings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Earlier at the south-eastern city of Almaty, Kazakhstan's financial capital was in chaos as police fired tear gas and stun grenades to quell the unrest. The president went on television and called for peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: VLADIMIR PUTIN, Russian President of the United States of America CALLS TO ATTACK CIVILIAN AND MILITARY OFFICES ARE COMPLETELY ILLEGAL.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: THESE ARE CRIMES THAT WILL BE PUNISHED.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: POWER WILL NOT FALL. Power will not fall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We don't need conflict but mutual trust and dialogue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The anger began on Sunday after liquefied natural gas prices spiked in the resource-rich western city of Janosin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the protests have taken on a more political hue in some places, as pent-up frustrations were released about the lack of government accountability in the authoritarian country. Since the former Soviet republic achieved its independence, a small elite have amassed enormous wealth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While life for many ordinary Kazakhs is hard going, particularly in the resource-rich West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's crunch time for Britain's Prince Andrew. A New York judge will soon decide if the Dufresne Andrew lawsuit is to be thrown out of court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This comes as a long-awaited 2009 settlement document between the plaintiff, Virginia Dufresne, and the late but disgraced businessman, Jeffrey Epstein, was released on Monday. Dufresne sued Prince Andrew last August, accusing him of sexually assaulting her in 2001, when she was just 17 years old, on several occasions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: She claims Epstein arranged the encounters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Prince denies all the allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, former socialite and girlfriend of Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, was found guilty of grooming teenage girls for sexual encounters with the financier between 1994 and 2004 in the final days of December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, lawyers for the royal have argued the settlement protects him and that Dufresne cannot sue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Susan Tirani was listening to the arguments put forward by the Prince's lawyers and has more from New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tennis star Novak Djokovic will be on the next plane home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to the Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Following the news that the world's number one has been granted a COVID-19 medical exemption to enter the country ahead of the Australian Open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the champion has sparked public outrage after repeatedly refusing to confirm if he has been inoculated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think it's a disgrace. We've all done the right thing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We've all gone out and got our jabs and our boosters and we have someone that's come from overseas and all of a sudden he's been exempt and can play and I think it's an absolute disgrace and I won't be watching it. I really don't agree with there being one rule for one and another rule for others so I feel that there should be some, he shouldn't be allowed to come. It's his choice not to be vaccinated which is fine and's, I think the government here has made the choice that, you know, you should be vaccinated. I don't know how you can get a medical exemption when you play that, when you're that fit and you play and you're number one in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, I think as long as the exemption is valid and they have valid reasons, I don't see a problem with that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Canberra says Djokovic must provide reasonable evidence as to why he cannot be vaccinated and that there will be no special rules for the nine-time Australian Open winner.
